channel.title: Corrosion on African Uhambo
channel.description: Recent content in Corrosion on African Uhambo

item.title: Upstand repair done
item.description:
The landy is now back to normal the whole repair is done, seats are in soundproofing back.

Now we have the fun of packing for the trip. Sorry I did not take a picture of the finished article! But the picture above shows the first of three seats fitted.

Must dash need to iron my pants.

item.title: Upstand Corrosion Repair
item.description:
I promised to do some posts about our planned trip, which we are due to depart on in 11 days. As of now we have not even booked the channel tunnel crossing or got our international driving permits. We are cutting it fine this year.

The photo shows some horrible corrosion I needed to get fixed before we go. It is in the area of the second row seat brackets on the upstand. Fairly typical of what happens when you combine steel and aluminium. Electrolytic corrosion.

Right now I am in the throws of stripping the floor and getting the panel out. The end caps were particularly hard due to a hidden solid rivet under the c post bracket.

New panels are from YRM, I got the upstanding and end brackets from them. I also have a galvanised crossmember I am not sure if I will fit that yet.

I hope to post more pictures as I go.

Stay tuned!
